meanings.definition: Beyond or surpassing the natural world.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious creature had transnatural powers that amazed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The glowing orb emitted a transnatural light that lit up the dark forest.
meanings.sent3: The transnatural abilities of the alien made it the star of the intergalactic circus.
meanings.sent4: Her beauty was so transnatural, it seemed to radiate from within.
meanings.sent5: The transnatural landscape of the enchanted forest was like something out of a dream.

meanings.definition: Something that exists or occurs outside of nature.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the transnatural phenomenon with great curiosity.
meanings.sent2: Legends speak of transnatural beings that roam the earth under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the idea of a transnatural creature stealing socks from the laundry.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the abandoned house felt transnatural, as if time stood still.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a transnatural landscape where reality and fantasy intertwined.

meanings.sent1: The town was abuzz with rumors of a transnatural event occurring in the old cemetery.
meanings.sent2: The ghost hunter specialized in capturing evidence of transnatural occurrences on camera.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about a transnatural being trying to navigate a grocery store.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury seemed transnatural, as if nature itself was angry.
meanings.sent5: The author's novel delved into the realm of transnatural beings and their interactions with humans.
